availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Camp Burnett in Montgomery County, Tennessee. Organized on September 13, 1861, and surrendered on May 6, 1865. Commander(s): Col. Robert P. Trabue, Col. Joseph Pouncey Nichols, Col. Thomas Williams Thompson, Lt. Col. Andrew R. Hynes and Lt. Col. John Alexander Adair.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 142.
